creator: huckleberry@catcha.com
text:
Background information

Log4J 1.1.3 on Sun Solaris v 5.8, being used in conjunction with IBM JDK 1.3
(the one that ships with WebSphere v4). The application in question is a stand 
alone java program that uses log4j for logging...the program uses the 
Categories the usual way, the application makes use of the 
DailyRollingFileAppender in conjunction with the AysncAppender

Scenario

If an user A invokes the program(first invocation of the program) and the log 
files get created with the default permissions of the user A, now when user B 
invokes the same program and he does not have rights to write to the log file 
created by the earlier run of the program, now log4j generates a message to 
inform the user of the inability to write to the file because it lacks the 
permissions...and in the due course the program terminates...but log4j threads 
wont terminate even though the program calls the shutdown() function on the 
Category.

One way is to ensure that the permissions are set in the right fashion...was 
wondering if a sucessful termination in any event would be more desirable.

If I got it all wrong or if I am barking against the wrong tree...my apologies!

Please feel free to contact me if you need any information or if you need me to 
do some more testing. Thanks.
